output.dependency: The name of the beer may determine the type of beer it is categorized under (e.g., 'Nonstop Hef Hop' is always an 'American Pale Wheat Ale').
The size description of the beer (oz or ounce) may correlate with the alcohol content, which is provided in a percentage or decimal format.
The brewery name could suggest the location (city) where it operates, indicating that beers by 'Hopworks Urban Brewery' are all produced in 'Portland'.
The city where the brewery is located (e.g., 'Portland') may depend on the state (e.g., 'OR'), indicating that beers produced in Portland are from Oregon.
Brew ID (column 1) might be a unique identifier that determines the beer name (column 2), suggesting a single beer corresponds to a unique identifier.
